tool_description: [DISCOUNT] Weather forecasts to the minute, weather alerts, historical data and astronomy data.
title: KayuloWeather

api_list.name: Weather Alert

required_parameters.name: language
required_parameters.description: The IETF BCP 47 language tag to use for localizing responses.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: The unique identifier for the weather alert.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://kayuloweather.p.rapidapi.com/weatherAlert/{language}/{id}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kayuloweather.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

area.description: An object defining a geographic region.

items.description: The official text describing a severe weather event from the agency.

language.description: The ISO language code that the text is in.

messages.description: An array of official text messages describing a severe weather event from the agency.

api_list.name: Weather
api_list.description:
Obtain weather data for the specified location.

The `dataSets` query parameter is used to obtain different data, like forecasts and current weather. Thus not all query parameters are needed for every data set. See the description of the query parameters to identify, which parameter is needed for which data set.

required_parameters.name: timezone
required_parameters.description: The name of the timezone to use for rolling up weather forecasts into daily forecasts.

required_parameters.name: longitude
required_parameters.description: The longitude of the desired location.

required_parameters.name: language
required_parameters.description: The IETF BCP 47 language tag to use for localizing responses.

required_parameters.name: latitude
required_parameters.description: The latitude of the desired location.

optional_parameters.name: dataSets
optional_parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of data sets to include in the response.

optional_parameters.name: currentAsOf
optional_parameters.description:
The time to obtain current conditions. Defaults to now. (This parameter is relevant for current weather only and cannot be used in combination with other data sets.)
Example: 2022-12-01T10:00:00Z

optional_parameters.name: hourlyStart
optional_parameters.description:
The time to start the hourly forecast. If this parameter is absent, hourly forecasts start on the current hour. (This parameter is relevant for hourly forecasts only and cannot be used in combination with other data sets.)
Example: 2022-12-01T10:00:00Z

optional_parameters.name: hourlyEnd
optional_parameters.description:
The time to end the hourly forecast. If this parameter is absent, hourly forecasts run 24 hours or the length of the daily forecast, whichever is longer. (This parameter is relevant for hourly forecasts only and cannot be used in combination with other data sets.)
Example: 2022-12-01T10:00:00Z

optional_parameters.name: countryCode
optional_parameters.description: The ISO Alpha-2 country code for the requested location. This parameter is necessary for weather alerts.

optional_parameters.name: dailyEnd
optional_parameters.description:
The time to end the daily forecast. If this parameter is absent, daily forecasts run for 10 days. (This parameter is relevant for daily forecasts onlyand cannot be used in combination with other data sets.)
Example: 2022-12-01T10:00:00Z

optional_parameters.name: dailyStart
optional_parameters.description:
The time to start the daily forecast. If this parameter is absent, daily forecasts start on the current day. (This parameter is relevant for daily forecasts only and cannot be used in combination with other data sets.)
Example: 2022-12-01T10:00:00Z

currentWeather.description: The current weather conditions for the specified location.

attributionURL.description: The URL of the legal attribution for the data source.

expireTime.description: The time when the weather data is no longer valid.

latitude.description: A numeric value indicating the latitude of the coordinate between -90 and 90.

longitude.description: A numeric value indicating the longitude of the coordinate between -180 and 180.

providerLogo.description: The URL of a logo for the data provider.

providerName.description: The name of the data provider.

readTime.description: The time the weather data was procured.

reportedTime.description: The time the provider reported the weather data.

temporarilyUnavailable.description: The weather data is temporarily unavailable from the provide

units.description: The system of units that the weather data is reported in. This is fixed and set to metric.

asOf.description: The date and time of the weather data.

cloudCover.description: The percentage of the sky covered with clouds during the period, from 0 to 1.

conditionCode.description: An enumeration value indicating the condition at the time.

daylight.description: A Boolean value indicating whether there is daylight.

precipitationIntensity.description: The precipitation intensity, in millimeters per hour.

pressure.description: The sea level air pressure, in millibars.

pressureTrend.description: The direction of change of the sea-level air pressure.

temperature.description: The current temperature, in degrees Celsius.

temperatureApparent.description: The feels-like temperature when factoring wind and humidity, in degrees Celsius.

temperatureDewPoint.description: The temperature at which relative humidity is 100%, in Celsius.

visibility.description: The distance at which terrain is visible, in meters.

windDirection.description: The direction of the wind, in degrees.

windGust.description: The maximum wind gust speed, in kilometers per hour.

windSpeed.description: The wind speed, in kilometers per hour.

items.description: The historical or forecasted weather conditions for a specified day.

conditionCode.description: An enumeration value indicating the condition at the time.

daytimeForecast.description: A summary forecast for a daytime or overnight period.

cloudCover.description: The percentage of the sky covered with clouds during the period, from 0 to 1.

conditionCode.description: An enumeration value indicating the condition at the time.

forecastEnd.description: The ending date and time of the forecast.

forecastStart.description: The starting date and time of the forecast.

humidity.description: The relative humidity during the period, from 0 to 1.

precipitationAmount.description: The amount of precipitation forecasted to occur during the period, in millimeters.

precipitationChance.description: The chance of precipitation forecasted to occur during the period.

precipitationType.description:
The type of precipitation forecasted to occur for a forecast period.

* `clear`: No precipitation is occurring.
* `precipitation`: An unknown type of precipitation is occuring.
* `rain`: Rain or freezing rain is falling.
* `snow`: Snow is falling.
* `sleet`: Sleet or ice pellets are falling.
* `hail`: Hail is falling.
* `mixed`: Winter weather (wintery mix or wintery showers) is falling.

snowfallAmount.description: The depth of snow as ice crystals forecasted to occur during the period, in millimeters.

windDirection.description: The direction the wind is forecasted to come from during the period, in degrees.

windSpeed.description: The average speed the wind is forecasted to be during the period, in kilometers per hour.

forecastEnd.description: The ending date and time of the day.

forecastStart.description: The starting date and time of the day.

maxUvIndex.description: The maximum ultraviolet index value during the day.

moonPhase.description:
The shape of the moon as seen by an observer on the ground at a given time.
* `new`: The moon isn't visible.
* `waxingCrescent`: A crescent-shaped sliver of the moon is visible, and increasing in size.
* `firstQuarter`: Approximately half of the moon is visible, and increasing in size.
* `full`: The entire disc of the moon is visible.
* `waxingGibbous`: More than half of the moon is visible, and increasing in size.
* `waningGibbous`: More than half of the moon is visible, and decreasing in size.
* `thirdQuarter`: Approximately half of the moon is visible, and decreasing in size.
* `waningCrescent`: A crescent-shaped sliver of the moon is visible, and decreasing in size.

moonrise.description: The time of moonrise on the specified day.

moonset.description: The time of moonset on the specified day.

overnightForecast.description: A summary forecast for a daytime or overnight period.

solarNoon.description: The time when the sun is highest in the sky.

providerName.description: The name of the data provider.

readTime.description: The time the weather data was procured.

reportedTime.description: The time the provider reported the weather data.

temporarilyUnavailable.description: The weather data is temporarily unavailable from the provide

units.description: The system of units that the weather data is reported in. This is fixed and set to metric.

items.description: Detailed information about the weather alert.

areaId.description: An official designation of the affected area.

areaName.description: A human-readable name of the affected area.

certainty.description:
How likely the event is to occur.

* `observed`: The event has already occurred or is ongoing.
* `likely`: The event is likely to occur (greater than 50% probability).
* `possible`: The event is unlikley to occur (less than 50% probability).
* `unlikely`: The event is not expected to occur (approximately 0% probability).
* `unknown`: It is unknown if the event will occur.

countryCode.description: The ISO code of the reporting country.

description.description: A human-readable description of the event.

detailsUrl.description: The URL to a page containing detailed information about the event.

effectiveTime.description: The time the event went into effect.

eventEndTime.description: The time when the underlying weather event is projected to end.

eventOnsetTime.description: The time when the underlying weather event is projected to start.

expireTime.description: The time when the event expires.

id.description: A unique identifier of the event.

issuedTime.description: The time that event was issued by the reporting agency.

items.description:
The recommended action from a reporting agency.

* `shelter`: Take shelter in place.
* `evacuate`: Relocate.
* `prepare`: Make preparations.
* `execute`: Execute a pre-planned activity.
* `avoid`: Avoid the event.
* `monitor`: Monitor the situation.
* `assess`: Assess the situation.
* `allClear`: The event no longer poses a threat.
* `none`: No action recommended.

responses.description: An array of recommended actions from the reporting agency.

severity.description:
The level of danger to life and property.

* `extreme`: Extraordinary threat.
* `severe`: Significant threat.
* `moderate`: Possible threat.
* `minor`: Minimal or no known threat.
* `unknown`: Unknown threat.

source.description: The name of the reporting agency.

urgency.description:
An indication of urgency of action from the reporting agency.

* `immediate`: Take responsive action immediately.
* `expected`: Take responsive action in the next hour.
* `future`: Take responsive action in the near future.
* `past`: Responsive action is no longer required.
* `unknown`: The urgency is unknown.

api_list.name: Availability
api_list.description: Determine the data sets available for the specified location.

required_parameters.name: latitude
required_parameters.description: The latitude of the desired location.

required_parameters.name: longitude
required_parameters.description: The longitude of the desired location.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://kayuloweather.p.rapidapi.com/availability/{latitude}/{longitude}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kayuloweather.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

items.description:
* `currentWeather`: The current weather for the requested location. Also works for past days, see `currentAsOf` query parameter.
* `forecastDaily`: The daily forecast for the requested location. Also works for past days, see `dailyStart` and `dailyEnd` query parameters.
* `forecastHourly`: The hourly forecast for the requested location. Also works for past days, see `hourlyStart` and `hourlyEnd` query parameters.
* `forecastNextHour`: The next hour forecast for the requested location.
* `weatherAlerts`: Weather alerts for the requested location.
